ReferenceBlocks.text: Or how can you tell your brother, ‘Brother, let me remove the speck of chaff that is in your eye,’ when you yourself don't see the beam that is in your own eye? You hypocrite! First remove the beam from your own eye, and then you can see clearly to remove the speck of chaff that is in your brother's eye.

block.text: Y si no te das cuenta del tronco que tienes en tu propio ojo, ¿cómo te atreves a decir a tu hermano: <Hermano, déjame sacarte la astilla que tienes en el ojo>? ¡Hipócrita!, saca primero el tronco de tu propio ojo, y así podrás ver bien para sacar la astilla que tiene tu hermano en el suyo.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For there is no good tree that brings forth rotten fruit; nor again a rotten tree that brings forth good fruit.

block.text: <<No hay árbol bueno que pueda dar fruto malo, ni árbol malo que pueda dar fruto bueno.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For each tree is known by its own fruit. For people don't gather figs from thorns, nor do they gather grapes from a bramble bush.

block.text: Cada árbol se conoce por su fruto: no se cosechan higos de los espinos, ni se recogen uvas de las zarzas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The good man out of the good treasure of his heart brings out that which is good, and the evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart brings out that which is evil, for out of the abundance of the heart, his mouth speaks.”

block.text: El hombre bueno dice cosas buenas porque el bien está en su corazón, y el hombre malo dice cosas malas porque el mal está en su corazón. Pues de lo que abunda en su corazón habla su boca.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you call me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ and don't do the things which I say?

block.text: <<¿Por qué me llaman ustedes, <Señor, Señor>, y no hacen lo que les digo?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Everyone who comes to me, and hears my words, and does them, I will show you who he is like.

block.text: Voy a decirles a quién se parece el que viene a mí y me oye y hace lo que digo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: He is like a man building a house, who dug and went deep, and laid a foundation on the rock. When a flood arose, the stream broke against that house, and could not shake it, because it was founded on the rock.

block.text: se parece a un hombre que para construir una casa cavó primero bien hondo, y puso la base sobre la roca. Cuando creció el río, el agua dio con fuerza contra la casa, pero ni moverla pudo, porque estaba bien construida.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he who hears, and doesn't do, is like a man who built a house on the earth without a foundation, against which the stream broke, and immediately it fell, and the ruin of that house was great.”

block.text: Pero el que me oye y no hace lo que digo, se parece a un hombre que construyó su casa sobre la tierra y sin cimientos; y cuando el río creció y dio con fuerza contra ella, se derrumbó y quedó completamente destruida.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 7
After he had finished speaking in the hearing of the people, he entered into Capernaum.

block.text: Cuando Jesús terminó de hablar a la gente, se fue a Cafarnaúm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A certain centurion's servant, who was dear to him, was sick and at the point of death.

block.text: Vivía allí un capitán romano que tenía un criado al que estimaba mucho, el cual estaba enfermo y a punto de morir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he heard about Jesus, he sent to him elders of the Jews, asking him to come and save his servant.

block.text: Cuando el capitán oyó hablar de Jesús, mandó a unos ancianos de los judíos a rogarle que fuera a sanar a su criado.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they came to Jesus, they begged him earnestly, saying,

block.text: Ellos se presentaron a Jesús y le rogaron mucho, diciendo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He is worthy for you to do this for him,
for he loves our nation, and he built our synagogue for us.”

block.text: Este capitán merece que lo ayudes,
porque ama a nuestra nación y él mismo hizo construir nuestra sinagoga.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus went with them. When he was now not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to him, saying to him,

block.text: Jesús fue con ellos, pero cuando ya estaban cerca de la casa, el capitán mandó unos amigos a decirle:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, don't trouble yourself, for I am not worthy for you to come under my roof.

block.text: <<Señor, no te molestes, porque yo no merezco que entres en mi casa;

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore I didn't even think myself worthy to come to you; but say the word, and my servant will be healed.

block.text: por eso, ni siquiera me atreví a ir en persona a buscarte. Solamente da la orden, para que sane mi criado.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I also am a man placed under authority, having under myself soldiers. I tell this one, ‘Go!’ and he goes; and to another, ‘Come!’ and he comes; and to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”

block.text: Porque yo mismo estoy bajo órdenes superiores, y a la vez tengo soldados bajo mi mando. Cuando le digo a uno de ellos que vaya, va; cuando le digo a otro que venga, viene; y cuando mando a mi criado que haga algo, lo hace.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus heard these things, he marveled at him, and turned and said to the multitude who followed him,

block.text: Jesús se quedó admirado al oir esto, y mirando a la gente que lo seguía dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I tell you, I have not found such great faith, no, not in Israel.”

block.text: Les aseguro que ni siquiera en Israel he encontrado tanta fe como en este hombre.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who were sent, returning to the house, found that the servant who had been sick was well.

block.text: Al regresar a la casa, los enviados encontraron que el criado ya estaba sano.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened soon afterwards, that he went to a city called Nain. Many of his disciples, along with a great multitude, went with him.

block.text: Después de esto, Jesús se dirigió a un pueblo llamado Naín. Iba acompañado de sus discípulos y de mucha gente.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when he drew near to the gate of the city, behold, one who was dead was carried out, the only son of his mother, and she was a widow. Many people of the city were with her.

block.text: Al llegar cerca del pueblo, vio que llevaban a enterrar a un muerto, hijo único de su madre, que era viuda. Mucha gente del pueblo la acompañaba.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the Lord saw her, he had compassion on her, and said to her,

block.text: Al verla, el Señor tuvo compasión de ella y le dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't cry.”

block.text: No llores.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came near and touched the coffin, and the bearers stood still. He said,

block.text: En seguida se acercó y tocó la camilla, y los que la llevaban se detuvieron. Jesús le dijo al muerto:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Young man, I tell you, arise!”

block.text: Joven, a ti te digo: ¡Levántate!

ReferenceBlocks.text: The young man who was dead sat up, and began to speak. And Jesus returned him to his mother saying:

block.text: Entonces el que había estado muerto se sentó y comenzó a hablar, y Jesús se lo entregó a la madre, diciendo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Receive your son.”

block.text: <<Recibe a tu hijo>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Fear took hold of all, and they glorified God, saying,

block.text: Al ver esto, todos tuvieron miedo y comenzaron a alabar a Dios, diciendo:

block.characterId: crowd, large (witnessed healing of widow's son)

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: crowd, large (witnessed healing of widow's son)
ReferenceBlocks.text: “A great prophet has arisen among us!”

block.text: Un gran profeta ha aparecido entre nosotros.

ReferenceBlocks.text: and,

block.text: y

block.characterId: crowd, large (witnessed healing of widow's son)

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: crowd, large (witnessed healing of widow's son)
ReferenceBlocks.text: “God has visited his people!”

block.text: Dios ha venido a ayudar a su pueblo.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This report went out concerning him in the whole of Judea, and in all the surrounding region.

block.text: Y por toda Judea y sus alrededores se supo lo que había hecho Jesús.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The disciples of John told him about all these things.

block.text: Juan tuvo noticias de todas estas cosas, pues sus seguidores se las contaron. Llamó a dos de ellos

ReferenceBlocks.text: John, calling to himself two of his disciples, sent them to Jesus, saying,

block.text: y los envió al Señor, a preguntarle:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are you the one who is coming, or should we look for another?”

block.text: <<eres tu el que había de venir o debemos esperar a otro>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the men had come to him, they said,

block.text: Los enviados de Juan se acercaron, pues, a Jesús y le dijeron:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “John the Baptizer has sent us to you, saying, ‘Are you he who comes, or should we look for another?’”

block.text: Juan el Bautista nos ha mandado a preguntarte si tú eres el que ha de venir, o si debemos esperar a otro.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In that hour he cured many of diseases and plagues and evil spirits; and to many who were blind he gave sight.
Jesus answered them,

block.text: En aquel mismo momento Jesús curó a muchas personas de sus enfermedades y sufrimientos, y de los espíritus malignos, y dio la vista a muchos ciegos.
Luego les contestó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go and tell John the things which you have seen and heard: that the blind receive their sight, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, and the poor have good news preached to them.

block.text: Vayan y díganle a Juan lo que han visto y oído. Cuéntenle que los ciegos ven, los cojos andan, los leprosos quedan limpios de su enfermedad, los sordos oyen, los muertos vuelven a la vida y a los pobres se les anuncia la buena noticia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed is he who finds no occasion for stumbling in me.”

block.text: ¡Y dichoso aquel que no pierda su fe en mí!

ReferenceBlocks.text: When John's messengers had departed, he began to tell the multitudes about John,

block.text: Cuando los enviados de Juan se fueron, Jesús comenzó a hablar a la gente acerca de Juan, diciendo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?

block.text: <<¿Qué salieron ustedes a ver al desierto? ¿Una caña sacudida por el viento?

ReferenceBlocks.text: But what did you go out to see? A man clothed in soft clothing? Behold, those who are gorgeously dressed, and live delicately, are in kings’ courts.

block.text: Y si no, ¿qué salieron a ver? ¿Un hombre vestido con ropas lujosas? Ustedes saben que los que se visten lujosamente y viven en placeres, están en las casas de los reyes.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and much more than a prophet.

block.text: En fin, ¿qué salieron a ver? ¿Un profeta? Sí, de veras, y uno que es mucho más que profeta.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is he of whom it is written, ‘Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you.’”

block.text: Juan es aquel de quien dice la Escritura: <Yo envío mi mensajero delante de ti, para que te prepare el camino.> m

ReferenceBlocks.text: “For I tell you, among those who are born of women there is not a greater prophet than John the Baptizer, yet he who is least in the Kingdom of God is greater than he.”

block.text: Les digo que, entre todos los hombres, ninguno ha sido más grande que Juan; y, sin embargo, el más pequeño en el reino de Dios es más grande que él.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When all the people and the tax collectors heard this, they declared God to be just, having been baptized with John's baptism.

block.text: Todos los que oyeron a Juan, incluso los que cobraban impuestos para Roma, se hicieron bautizar por él, cumpliendo así las justas exigencias de Dios;

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the Pharisees and the lawyers rejected the counsel of God, not being baptized by him themselves.

block.text: pero los fariseos y los maestros de la ley no se hicieron bautizar por Juan, despreciando de este modo lo que Dios había querido hacer en favor de ellos.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “To what then will I liken the people of this generation? What are they like?

block.text: <<¿A qué compararé la gente de este tiempo? ¿A qué se parece?

ReferenceBlocks.text: They are like children who sit in the marketplace, and call one to another, saying, ‘We piped to you, and you didn't dance. We mourned, and you didn't weep.’

block.text: Se parece a los niños que se sientan a jugar en la plaza y gritan a sus compañeros: <Tocamos la flauta, pero ustedes no bailaron; cantamos canciones tristes, pero ustedes no lloraron.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: For John the Baptizer came neither eating bread nor drinking wine, and you say, ‘He has a demon.’

block.text: Porque vino Juan el Bautista, que ni come pan ni bebe vino, y ustedes dicen que tiene un demonio.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Son of Man has come eating and drinking, and you say, ‘Behold, a gluttonous man, and a drunkard; a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’

block.text: Luego ha venido el Hijo del hombre, que come y bebe, y ustedes dicen que es glotón y bebedor, amigo de gente de mala fama y de los que cobran impuestos para Roma.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Wisdom is justified by all her children.”

block.text: Pero la sabiduría de Dios se demuestra por todos sus resultados.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: One of the Pharisees invited him to eat with him. He entered into the Pharisee's house, and sat at the table.

block.text: Un fariseo invitó a Jesús a comer, y Jesús fue a su casa. Estaba sentado a la mesa,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, a woman in the city who was a sinner, when she knew that he was reclining in the Pharisee's house, she brought an alabaster jar of ointment.

block.text: cuando una mujer de mala vida, que vivía en el mismo pueblo y que supo que Jesús había ido a comer a casa del fariseo, llegó con un frasco de alabastro lleno de perfume.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Standing behind at his feet weeping, she began to wet his feet with her tears, and she wiped them with the hair of her head, kissed his feet, and anointed them with the ointment.

block.text: Llorando, se puso junto a los pies de Jesús y comenzó a bañarlos con lágrimas. Luego los secó con sus cabellos, los besó y derramó sobre ellos el perfume.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when the Pharisee who had invited him saw it, he said to himself,

block.text: El fariseo que había invitado a Jesús, al ver esto, pensó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man, if he were a prophet, would have perceived who and what kind of woman this is who touches him, that she is a sinner.”

block.text: <<Si este hombre fuera de veras un profeta, se daría cuenta de qué clase de persona es esta que lo está tocando: una mujer de mala vida.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered him,

block.text: Entonces Jesús le dijo al fariseo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Simon, I have something to tell you.”

block.text: Simón, tengo algo que decirte.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: El fariseo contestó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell me teacher,”

block.text: Dímelo, Maestro.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus replied:

block.text: Jesús siguió:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A certain lender had two debtors. The one owed five hundred denarii, and the other fifty.

block.text: Dos hombres le debían dinero a un prestamista. Uno le debía quinientos denarios, y el otro cincuenta;

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they couldn't pay, he forgave them both. Which of them therefore will love him most?”

block.text: y como no le podían pagar, el prestamista les perdonó la deuda a los dos. Ahora dime, ¿cuál de ellos le amará más?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon answered,

block.text: Simón le contestó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He, I suppose, to whom he forgave the most.”

block.text: Me parece que el hombre a quien más le perdonó.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Jesús le dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You have judged correctly.”

block.text: Tienes razón.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Turning to the woman, he said to Simon,

block.text: Entonces, mirando a la mujer, Jesús dijo a Simón:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you see this woman? I entered into your house, and you gave me no water for my feet, but she has wet my feet with her tears, and wiped them with the hair of her head.

block.text: ¿Ves esta mujer? Entré en tu casa, y no me diste agua para mis pies; en cambio, esta mujer me ha bañado los pies con sus lágrimas y los ha secado con sus cabellos.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You gave me no kiss, but she, since the time I came in, has not ceased to kiss my feet.

block.text: No me saludaste con un beso, pero ella, desde que entré, no ha dejado de besarme los pies.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You didn't anoint my head with oil, but she has anointed my feet with ointment.

block.text: No me pusiste ungüento en la cabeza, pero ella ha derramado perfume sobre mis pies.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore I tell you, her sins, which are many, are forgiven, for she loved much. But to whom little is forgiven, the same loves little.”

block.text: Por esto te digo que sus muchos pecados son perdonados, porque amó mucho; pero la persona a quien poco se le perdona, poco amor muestra.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to her,

block.text: Luego dijo a la mujer:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Your sins are forgiven.”

block.text: Tus pecados te son perdonados.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who sat at the table with him began to say to themselves,

block.text: Los otros invitados que estaban allí, comenzaron a preguntarse:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who is this who even forgives sins?”

block.text: ¿Quién es este, que hasta perdona pecados?

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to the woman,

block.text: Pero Jesús añadió, dirigiéndose a la mujer:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Your faith has saved you. Go in peace.”

block.text: Por tu fe has sido salvada; vete tranquila.

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 8
It happened soon afterwards, that he went about through cities and villages, preaching and bringing the good news of the Kingdom of God. With him were the twelve,

block.text: Después de esto, Jesús anduvo por muchos pueblos y aldeas, anunciando la buena noticia del reino de Dios. Los doce apóstoles lo acompañaban,

ReferenceBlocks.text: and certain women who had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities: Mary who was called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out;

block.text: como también algunas mujeres que él había curado de espíritus malignos y enfermedades. Entre ellas iba María, la llamada Magdalena, de la que habían salido siete demonios;

ReferenceBlocks.text: and Joanna, the wife of Chuzas, Herod's steward; Susanna; and many others; who served them from their possessions.

block.text: también Juana, esposa de Cuza, el que era administrador de Herodes; y Susana; y muchas otras que los ayudaban con lo que tenían.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When a great multitude came together, and people from every city were coming to him, he spoke by a parable.

block.text: Muchos salieron de los pueblos para ver a Jesús, de manera que se reunió mucha gente. Entonces les contó esta parábola:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The farmer went out to sow his seed. As he sowed, some fell along the road, and it was trampled under foot, and the birds of the sky devoured it.

block.text: <<Un sembrador salió a sembrar su semilla. Y al sembrar, una parte de la semilla cayó en el camino, y fue pisoteada, y las aves se la comieron.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Other seed fell on the rock, and as soon as it grew, it withered away, because it had no moisture.

block.text: Otra parte cayó entre las piedras; y cuando esa semilla brotó, se secó por falta de humedad.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Other fell amid the thorns, and the thorns grew with it, and choked it.

block.text: Otra parte de la semilla cayó entre espinos; y al nacer juntamente, los espinos la ahogaron.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Other fell into the good ground, and grew, and brought forth fruit one hundred times.”

block.text: Pero otra parte cayó en buena tierra; y creció, y dio una buena cosecha, hasta de cien granos por semilla.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he said these things, he called out,

block.text: Esto dijo Jesús, y añadió con voz muy fuerte:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He who has ears to hear, let him hear!”

block.text: <<¡Los que tienen oídos, oigan!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then his disciples asked him,

block.text: Los discípulos le preguntaron a Jesús:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What does this parable mean?”

block.text: << qué significa esta parábola?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Les dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “To you it is given to know the mysteries of the Kingdom of God, but to the rest in parables; that ‘seeing they may not see, and hearing they may not understand.’

block.text: <<A ustedes Dios les da a conocer los secretos de su reino; pero a los otros les hablo por medio de parábolas, para que por más que miren no vean, y por más que oigan no entiendan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.

block.text: <<Esto es lo que quiere decir la parábola: La semilla representa el mensaje de Dios;

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those along the road are those who hear, then the devil comes, and takes away the word from their heart, that they may not believe and be saved.

block.text: y la parte que cayó por el camino representa a los que oyen el mensaje, pero viene el diablo y se lo quita del corazón, para que no crean y se salven.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those on the rock are they who, when they hear, receive the word with joy; but these have no root, who believe for a while, then fall away in time of temptation.

block.text: La semilla que cayó entre las piedras representa a los que oyen el mensaje y lo reciben con gusto, pero no tienen suficiente raíz; creen por algún tiempo, pero a la hora de la prueba fallan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: That which fell among the thorns, these are those who have heard, and as they go on their way they are choked with cares, riches, and pleasures of life, and bring no fruit to maturity.

block.text: La semilla que cayó entre espinos representa a los que escuchan, pero poco a poco se dejan ahogar por las preocupaciones, las riquezas y los placeres de la vida, de modo que no llegan a dar fruto.

ReferenceBlocks.text: That in the good ground, these are such as in an honest and good heart, having heard the word, hold it tightly, and bring forth fruit with patience.”

block.text: Pero la semilla que cayó en buena tierra, son las personas que con corazón bueno y dispuesto escuchan y hacen caso del mensaje y, permaneciendo firmes, dan una buena cosecha.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “No one, when he has lit a lamp, covers it with a container, or puts it under a bed; but puts it on a stand, that those who enter in may see the light.

block.text: <<Nadie enciende una lámpara para después taparla con algo o ponerla debajo de la cama, sino que la pone en alto, para que tengan luz los que entran.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For nothing is hidden, that will not be revealed; nor anything secret, that will not be known and come to light.

block.text: De la misma manera, no hay nada escondido que no llegue a descubrirse, ni nada secreto que no llegue a conocerse y ponerse en claro.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Be careful therefore how you hear. For whoever has, to him will be given; and whoever doesn't have, from him will be taken away even that which he thinks he has.”

block.text: <<Así pues, oigan bien, pues al que tiene se le dará más; pero al que no tiene, hasta lo que cree tener se le quitará.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: His mother and brothers came to him, and they could not come near him for the crowd.

block.text: La madre y los hermanos de Jesús se presentaron donde él estaba, pero no pudieron acercarse a él porque había mucha gente.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It was told him by some saying,

block.text: Alguien avisó a Jesús:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Your mother and your brothers stand outside, desiring to see you.”

block.text: Tu madre y tus hermanos están ahí fuera, y quieren verte.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered them,

block.text: él contestó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “My mother and my brothers are these who hear the word of God, and do it.”

block.text: Los que oyen el mensaje de Dios y lo ponen en práctica, esos son mi madre y mis hermanos.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now it happened on one of those days, that he entered into a boat, himself and his disciples, and he said to them,

block.text: Un día, Jesús entró en una barca con sus discípulos, y les dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let's go over to the other side of the lake.”

block.text: Vamos al otro lado del lago.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So they launched out.
But as they sailed, he fell asleep. A wind storm came down on the lake, and they were taking on dangerous amounts of water.

block.text: Partieron, pues,
y mientras cruzaban el lago, Jesús se durmió. En esto se desató una fuerte tormenta sobre el lago, y la barca empezó a llenarse de agua y corrían peligro de hundirse.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came to him, and awoke him, saying,

block.text: Entonces fueron a despertar a Jesús, diciéndole:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Master, master, we are dying!”

block.text: ¡Maestro! ¡Maestro! ¡Nos estamos hundiendo!

ReferenceBlocks.text: He awoke, and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water, and they ceased, and it was calm.
He said to them,

block.text: Jesús se levantó y dio una orden al viento y a las olas, y todo se calmó y quedó tranquilo.
Después dijo a los discípulos:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where is your faith?”

block.text: ¿Qué pasó con su fe?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Being afraid they marveled, saying one to another,

block.text: Pero ellos, asustados y admirados, se preguntaban unos a otros:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who is this, then, that he commands even the winds and the water, and they obey him?”

block.text: ¿Quién será este, que da órdenes al viento y al agua, y lo obedecen?

ReferenceBlocks.text: They arrived at the country of the Gadarenes, which is opposite Galilee.

block.text: Por fin llegaron a la tierra de Gerasa, que está al otro lado del lago, frente a Galilea.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus stepped ashore, a certain man out of the city who had demons for a long time met him. He wore no clothes, and didn't live in a house, but in the tombs.

block.text: Al bajar Jesús a tierra, salió del pueblo un hombre que estaba endemoniado, y se le acercó. Hacía mucho tiempo que no se ponía ropa ni vivía en una casa, sino entre las tumbas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he saw Jesus, he cried out, and fell down before him, and with a loud voice said,

block.text: Cuando vio a Jesús, cayó de rodillas delante de él, gritando:

block.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons
ReferenceBlocks.text: “What do I have to do with you, Jesus, you Son of the Most High God? I beg you, don't torment me!”

block.text: ¡No te metas conmigo, Jesús, Hijo del Dios altísimo! ¡Te ruego que no me atormentes!

ReferenceBlocks.text: For Jesus was commanding the unclean spirit to come out of the man. For the unclean spirit had often seized the man. He was kept under guard, and bound with chains and fetters. Breaking the bands apart, he was driven by the demon into the desert.
Jesus asked him,

block.text: Dijo esto porque Jesús había ordenado al espíritu impuro que saliera de él. Muchas veces el demonio se había apoderado de él; y aunque la gente le sujetaba las manos y los pies con cadenas para tenerlo seguro, él las rompía y el demonio lo hacía huir a lugares desiertos.
Jesús le preguntó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What is your name?”

block.text: ¿Cómo te llamas?

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Y él contestó:

block.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Legion,”

block.text: Me llamo Legión.

ReferenceBlocks.text: for many demons had entered into him.
They begged him, saying:

block.text: Dijo esto porque eran muchos los demonios que habían entrado en él,
los cuales pidieron a Jesús repetidamente:

block.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do not send us into the abyss!”

block.text: <<No nos mandes al abismo!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now there was there a herd of many pigs feeding on the mountain. The Demons begged Jesus, saying:

block.text: Como había muchos cerdos comiendo en el cerro. Los demonios le rogaron a Jesús, diciendo:

block.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Allow us to enter into the pigs!”

block.text: "Nos permiten entrar en los cerdos!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He allowed them.

block.text: Él les permitió.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The demons came out
from the man, and entered into the pigs, and the herd rushed
down the steep bank into the lake,
and were drowned.

block.text: Los demonios salieron
entonces del hombre y entraron en los cerdos,
y estos echaron a correr pendiente abajo hasta el lago,
y allí se ahogaron.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When those who fed them saw what had happened, they fled, and told it in the city and in the country.

block.text: Los que cuidaban de los cerdos, cuando vieron lo sucedido, salieron huyendo y fueron a contarlo en el pueblo y por el campo.

ReferenceBlocks.text: People went out to see what had happened. They came to Jesus, and found the man from whom the demons had gone out, sitting at Jesus’ feet, clothed and in his right mind; and they were afraid.

block.text: La gente salió a ver lo que había pasado. Y cuando llegaron a donde estaba Jesús, encontraron sentado a sus pies al hombre de quien habían salido los demonios, vestido y en su cabal juicio; y tuvieron miedo.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who saw it told them how he who had been possessed by demons was healed.

block.text: Y los que habían visto lo sucedido, les contaron cómo había sido sanado aquel endemoniado.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All the people of the surrounding country of the Gadarenes asked him to depart from them, for they were very much afraid. He entered into the boat, and returned.

block.text: Toda la gente de la región de Gerasa comenzó entonces a rogar a Jesús que se fuera de allí, porque tenían mucho miedo. Así que Jesús entró en la barca y se fue.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the man from whom the demons had gone out begged him that he might go with him, but Jesus sent him away, saying,

block.text: El hombre de quien habían salido los demonios le rogó: <<Dejame ir contigo>> …pero Jesus le ordeno que se fuera, diciendo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Return to your house, and declare what great things God has done for you.”

block.text: Vuelve a tu casa y cuenta todo lo que Dios ha hecho por ti.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went his way, proclaiming throughout the whole city what great things Jesus had done for him.

block.text: El hombre se fue y contó por todo el pueblo lo que Jesús había hecho por él.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, when Jesus returned, that the multitude welcomed him, for they were all waiting for him.

block.text: Cuando Jesús regresó al otro lado del lago, la gente lo recibió con alegría, porque todos lo estaban esperando.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A ruler of the Synagogue named Jairus came and fell at Jesus's feet, and begged him, saying:

block.text: En esto llegó uno llamado Jairo, que era jefe de la sinagoga. Este hombre se postró a los pies de Jesús y le rogó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come to my house!”

block.text: <<Ven a mi casa>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: for he had an only daughter about twelve years of age, and she was dying. But as he went, the multitudes pressed against him.

block.text: porque tenía una sola hija, de unos doce años, que estaba a punto de morir. Mientras Jesús iba, se sentía apretujado por la multitud que lo seguía.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A woman was there who had a flow of blood for twelve years. She had spent all her living on physicians, and could not be healed by any.

block.text: Entre la gente había una mujer que desde hacía doce años estaba enferma, con derrames de sangre, y que había gastado en médicos todo lo que tenía, sin que ninguno la hubiera podido sanar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: She came up behind him and touched the fringe of his cloak. Immediately the flow of her blood stopped.
Jesus said,

block.text: Esta mujer se acercó a Jesús por detrás y tocó el borde de su capa, y en el mismo momento el derrame de sangre se detuvo.
Entonces Jesús preguntó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who touched me?”

block.text: ¿Quién me ha tocado?

ReferenceBlocks.text: They all denied it saying:

block.text: Todos negaban haberlo tocado, diciendo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Not I!”

block.text: <<Yo no fui>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter said:

block.text: Pedro dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Master, the multitudes press and jostle you, and you say, ‘Who touched me?’”

block.text: Maestro, la gente te oprime y empuja por todos lados.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus said,

block.text: Pero Jesús insistió:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Someone did touch me, for I perceived that power has gone out of me.”

block.text: Alguien me ha tocado, porque me he dado cuenta de que de mí ha salido poder.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the woman saw that she was not hidden, she came trembling, and fell down before him. She declared to him in the presence of all the people the reason why she had touched him, and how she was healed immediately.
He said to her,

block.text: La mujer, al ver que no podía esconderse, fue temblando a arrodillarse a los pies de Jesús. Le confesó delante de todos por qué razón lo había tocado, y cómo había sido sanada en el acto.
Jesús le dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Daughter, cheer up. Your faith has made you well. Go in peace.”

block.text: Hija, por tu fe has sido sanada. Vete tranquila.

ReferenceBlocks.text: While he still spoke, one from the ruler of the synagogue's house came, saying to him,

block.text: Todavía estaba hablando Jesús, cuando llegó un mensajero y le dijo al jefe de la sinagoga:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Your daughter is dead. Don't trouble the Teacher.”

block.text: Tu hija ha muerto; no molestes más al Maestro.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus hearing it, answered him,

block.text: Pero Jesús lo oyó y le dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't be afraid. Only believe, and she will be healed.”

block.text: No tengas miedo; solamente cree, y tu hija se salvará.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he came to the house, he didn't allow anyone to enter in, except Peter, John, James, the father of the child, and her mother.

block.text: Al llegar a la casa, no dejó entrar con él a nadie más que a Pedro, a Santiago y a Juan, junto con el padre y la madre de la niña.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All were weeping and mourning her but he said,

block.text: Todos estaban llorando y lamentándose por ella, pero Jesús les dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't weep. She isn't dead, but sleeping.”

block.text: No lloren; la niña no está muerta, sino dormida.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were ridiculing
him, knowing that she was dead.

block.text: Todos se rieron
de él, porque sabían que estaba muerta.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he put them all outside, and taking her by the hand, he called, saying,

block.text: Entonces Jesús la tomó de la mano y dijo con voz fuerte:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Child, arise!”

block.text: ¡Niña, levántate!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Her spirit returned and she rose up immediately. Jesus told them:

block.text: Y ella volvió a la vida; al momento se levantó. Entonces Jesús les dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Give her something to eat.”

block.text: <<Denle de comer>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Her parents were amazed, but he commanded them, saying:

block.text: Sus padres estaban muy admirados; pero Jesús les ordenó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell no one what has been done.”

block.text: <<No le cuenten a nadie lo que ha pasado>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 9
He called the twelve together, and gave them power and authority over all demons, and to cure diseases.

block.text: Jesús reunió a sus doce discípulos, y les dio poder y autoridad para expulsar toda clase de demonios y para curar enfermedades.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sent them forth to preach the Kingdom of God, and to heal the sick.
He said to them,

block.text: Los envió a anunciar el reino de Dios y a sanar a los enfermos.
Les dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Take nothing for your journey--neither staffs, nor wallet, nor bread, nor money; neither have two coats apiece.

block.text: No lleven nada para el camino: ni bastón, ni bolsa, ni pan, ni dinero, ni ropa de repuesto.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Into whatever house you enter, stay there, and depart from there.

block.text: En cualquier casa donde lleguen, quédense hasta que se vayan del lugar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As many as don't receive you, when you depart from that city, shake off even the dust from your feet for a testimony against them.”

block.text: Y si en algún pueblo no los quieren recibir, salgan de él y sacúdanse el polvo de los pies, para que les sirva a ellos de advertencia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They departed, and went throughout the villages, preaching the Good News, and healing everywhere.

block.text: Salieron ellos, pues, y fueron por todas las aldeas, anunciando la buena noticia y sanando enfermos.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Herod the tetrarch heard of all that was done by him; and he was very perplexed, because some said:

block.text: El rey Herodes oyó hablar de todo lo que sucedía; y no sabía qué pensar, porque unos decían:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “John had risen from the dead!”

block.text: <<Juan ha resucitado de los muertos>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: and others said,

block.text: otros decían:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Elijah has appeared,”

block.text: <<Elias ha aparecido>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: and still others said,

block.text: y otros decían:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “One of the old prophets had risen again.”

block.text: <<Uno de los antiguos profetas ha resucitado>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Herod said,

block.text: Pero Herodes dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “John I beheaded, so who is this about whom I hear such things?”

block.text: Yo mismo mandé que le cortaran la cabeza a Juan. ¿Quién será entonces este, de quien oigo contar tantas cosas?

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sought to see him.

block.text: Por eso Herodes procuraba ver a Jesús.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The apostles, when they had returned, told him what things they had done. He took them, and withdrew apart to a deserted place of a city called Bethsaida.

block.text: Cuando los apóstoles regresaron, contaron a Jesús lo que habían hecho. él, tomándolos aparte, los llevó a un pueblo llamado Betsaida.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the multitudes, perceiving it, followed him. He welcomed them, and spoke to them of the Kingdom of God, and he cured those who needed healing.

block.text: Pero cuando la gente lo supo, lo siguieron; y Jesús los recibió, les habló del reino de Dios y sanó a los enfermos.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Late in the day the twelve came and said to him,

block.text: Cuando ya comenzaba a hacerse tarde, se acercaron a Jesús los doce discípulos y le dijeron:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Send the multitude away, that they may go into the surrounding villages and farms, and lodge, and get food, for we are here in a deserted place.”

block.text: Despide a la gente, para que vayan a descansar y a buscar comida por las aldeas y los campos cercanos, porque en este lugar no hay nada.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said to them,

block.text: Jesús les dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You give them something to eat.”

block.text: Denles ustedes de comer.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Ellos contestaron:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We have no more than five loaves and two fish, unless we should go and buy food for all these people.”

block.text: No tenemos más que cinco panes y dos pescados, a menos que vayamos a comprar comida para toda esta gente.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For they were about five thousand men. He said to his disciples,

block.text: Pues eran unos cinco mil hombres. Pero Jesús dijo a sus discípulos:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Make them sit down in groups of about fifty each.”

block.text: Háganlos sentarse en grupos como de cincuenta.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They did so, and made them all sit down.

block.text: Ellos obedecieron e hicieron sentar a todos.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to the sky, he blessed them, and broke them, and gave them to the disciples to set before the multitude.

block.text: Luego Jesús tomó en sus manos los cinco panes y los dos pescados y, mirando al cielo, pronunció sobre ellos la bendición, los partió y se los dio a sus discípulos para que los repartieran entre la gente.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They ate, and were all filled. They gathered up twelve baskets of broken pieces that were left over.

block.text: La gente comió hasta quedar satisfecha, y recogieron en doce canastos los pedazos sobrantes.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, as he was praying alone, that the disciples were with him, and he asked them,

block.text: Un día en que Jesús estaba orando solo, y sus discípulos estaban con él, les preguntó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who do the multitudes say that I am?”

block.text: ¿Quién dice la gente que soy yo?

ReferenceBlocks.text: They answered,

block.text: Ellos contestaron:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “‘John the Baptizer,’ but others say, ‘Elijah,’ and others, that one of the old prophets is risen again.”

block.text: Algunos dicen que eres Juan el Bautista, otros dicen que eres Elías, y otros dicen que eres uno de los antiguos profetas, que ha resucitado.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: El les preguntó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But who do you say that I am?”

block.text: Y ustedes, ¿quién dicen que soy?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter answered,

block.text: Y Pedro le respondió:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Christ of God.”

block.text: Eres el Mesías de Dios.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus commanded them, saying:

block.text: Pero Jesús les advirtió, diciendo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell this to no one!”

block.text: "Dile esto a nadie!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he said:

block.text: Y les dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Son of Man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders, chief priests, and scribes, and be killed, and the third day be raised up.”

block.text: El Hijo del hombre tendrá que sufrir mucho, y será rechazado por los ancianos, por los jefes de los sacerdotes y por los maestros de la ley. Lo van a matar, pero al tercer día resucitará.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to all,

block.text: Después les dijo a todos:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If anyone desires to come after me, let him deny himself, take up his cross, and follow me.

block.text: Si alguno quiere ser discípulo mío, olvídese de sí mismo, cargue con su cruz cada día y sígame.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever desires to save his life will lose it, but whoever will lose his life for my sake, the same will save it.

block.text: Porque el que quiera salvar su vida, la perderá; pero el que pierda la vida por causa mía, la salvará.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For what does it profit a man if he gains the whole world, and loses or forfeits his own self?

block.text: ¿De qué le sirve al hombre ganar el mundo entero, si se pierde o se destruye a sí mismo?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever will be ashamed of me and of my words, of him will the Son of Man be ashamed, when he comes in his glory, and the glory of the Father, and of the holy angels.

block.text: Pues si alguno se avergüenza de mí y de mi mensaje, también el Hijo del hombre se avergonzará de él cuando venga con su gloria y con la gloria de su Padre y de los santos ángeles.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I tell you the truth: There are some of those who stand here, who will in no way taste of death, until they see the Kingdom of God.”

block.text: Les aseguro que algunos de los que están aquí presentes no morirán sin antes haber visto el reino de Dios.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened about eight days after these sayings, that he took with him Peter, John, and James, and went up onto the mountain to pray.

block.text: Unos ocho días después de esta conversación, Jesús subió a un cerro a orar, acompañado de Pedro, Santiago y Juan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he was praying, the appearance of his face was altered, and his clothing became white and dazzling.

block.text: Mientras oraba, el aspecto de su cara cambió, y su ropa se volvió muy blanca y brillante;

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, two men, Moses and Elijah,
appeared in glorious splendor, and spoke with Jesus of his departure, which he was about to accomplish at Jerusalem.

block.text: y aparecieron dos hombres conversando con él. Eran Moisés y Elías,
que estaban rodeados de un resplandor glorioso y hablaban de la partida de Jesús de este mundo, que iba a tener lugar en Jerusalén.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Peter and those who were with him were heavy with sleep, but when they were fully awake, they saw his glory, and the two men who stood with him.

block.text: Aunque Pedro y sus compañeros tenían mucho sueño, permanecieron despiertos, y vieron la gloria de Jesús y a los dos hombres que estaban con él.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, as they were parting from him, that Peter said to Jesus,

block.text: Cuando aquellos hombres se separaban ya de Jesús, Pedro le dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Master, it is good for us to be here. Let's make three tents: one for you, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah,”

block.text: Maestro, ¡qué bien que estemos aquí! Vamos a hacer tres chozas: una para ti, otra para Moisés y otra para Elías.

ReferenceBlocks.text: not knowing what he said.
While he said these things, a cloud came and overshadowed them, and they were afraid as they entered into the cloud.

block.text: Pero Pedro no sabía lo que decía.
Mientras hablaba, una nube se posó sobre ellos, y al verse dentro de la nube tuvieron miedo.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A voice came out of the cloud, saying,

block.text: Entonces de la nube salió una voz, que dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is my beloved Son. Listen to him!”

block.text: <<Este es mi Hijo, mi elegido: escúchenlo.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the voice came, Jesus was found alone. They were silent, and told no one in those days any of the things which they had seen.

block.text: Cuando se escuchó esa voz, Jesús quedó solo. Pero ellos mantuvieron esto en secreto y en aquel tiempo a nadie dijeron nada de lo que habían visto.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened on the next day, when they had come down from the mountain, that a great multitude met him.

block.text: Al día siguiente, cuando bajaron del cerro, una gran multitud salió al encuentro de Jesús.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, a man from the crowd cried out, saying,

block.text: Y un hombre de entre la gente le dijo con voz fuerte:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, I beg you to look at my son, for he is my only child.

block.text: Maestro, por favor, mira a mi hijo, que es el único que tengo;

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, a spirit takes him, he suddenly cries out, and it convulses him so that he foams, and it hardly departs from him, bruising him severely.

block.text: un espíritu lo agarra, y hace que grite y que le den ataques y que eche espuma por la boca. Lo maltrata y no lo quiere soltar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I begged your disciples to cast it out, and they couldn't.”

block.text: He rogado a tus discípulos que le saquen ese espíritu, pero no han podido.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered,

block.text: Jesús contestó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Faithless and perverse generation, how long shall I be with you and bear with you? Bring your son here.”

block.text: ¡Oh gente sin fe y perversa! ¿Hasta cuándo tendré que estar con ustedes y soportarlos? Trae acá a tu hijo.

ReferenceBlocks.text: While he was still coming, the demon threw him down and convulsed him violently. But Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, and healed the boy, and gave him back to his father.

block.text: Cuando el muchacho se acercaba, el demonio lo tiró al suelo e hizo que le diera otro ataque; pero Jesús reprendió al espíritu impuro, sanó al muchacho y se lo devolvió a su padre.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were all astonished and said:

block.text: Y todos se quedaron admirados de la grandeza de Dios y decian:

block.characterId: everyone who witnessed healing of boy

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: everyone who witnessed healing of boy
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold the majesty of God!”

block.text: "He aquí la grandeza de Dios!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: But while all were marveling at all the things that Jesus did, he said to his disciples,

block.text: Mientras todos se maravillaban de lo que Jesús hacía, él dijo a sus discípulos:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let these words sink into your ears, for the Son of Man will be delivered up into the hands of men.”

block.text: Oigan bien esto y no lo olviden: el Hijo del hombre va a ser entregado en manos de los hombres.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they didn't understand this saying. It was concealed from them, that they should not perceive it, and they were afraid to ask him about this saying.

block.text: Pero ellos no entendían lo que les decía, pues todavía no se les había abierto el entendimiento para comprenderlo; además tenían miedo de pedirle a Jesús que se lo explicara.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There arose an argument among them about which of them was the greatest.

block.text: Por entonces los discípulos comenzaron a discutir quién de ellos sería el más importante.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, perceiving the reasoning of their hearts, took a little child, and set him by his side,
and said to them,

block.text: Jesús, al darse cuenta de lo que estaban pensando, tomó a un niño, lo puso junto a él
y les dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Whoever receives this little child in my name receives me. Whoever receives me receives him who sent me. For whoever is least among you all, this one will be great.”

block.text: El que recibe a este niño en mi nombre, me recibe a mí; y el que me recibe a mí, recibe también al que me envió. Por eso, el más insignificante entre todos ustedes, ese es el más importante.

ReferenceBlocks.text: John answered,

block.text: Juan le dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Master, we saw someone casting out demons in your name, and we forbade him, because he doesn't follow with us.”

block.text: Maestro, hemos visto a uno que expulsaba demonios en tu nombre; y tratamos de impedírselo, porque no es de los nuestros.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Jesús le contestó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't forbid him, for he who is not against us is for us.”

block.text: No se lo prohíban, porque el que no está contra nosotros, está a nuestro favor.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It came to pass, when the days were near that he should be taken up, he resolutely set out for Jerusalem.

block.text: Cuando ya se acercaba el tiempo en que Jesús había de subir al cielo, emprendió con valor su viaje a Jerusalén.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sent messengers on ahead who went into a Samaritan village to get things ready for him.

block.text: Envió por delante mensajeros, que fueron a una aldea de Samaria para conseguirle alojamiento;

ReferenceBlocks.text: They didn't receive him because he was heading for Jerusalem.

block.text: pero los samaritanos no quisieron recibirlo, porque se daban cuenta de que se dirigía a Jerusalén.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When his disciples, James and John, saw this, they said,

block.text: Cuando sus discípulos Santiago y Juan vieron esto, le dijeron:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, do you want us to command fire to come down from the sky, and destroy them, just as Elijah did?”

block.text: Señor, ¿quieres que ordenemos que baje fuego del cielo, y que acabe con ellos?

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he turned and rebuked them,

block.text: Pero Jesús se volvió y los reprendió, diciendo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You don't know of what kind of spirit you are.
For the Son of Man didn't come to destroy men's lives, but to save them.”

block.text: <<Vosotros no sabeis de que espiritu sois,
porque el Hijo del Hombre no ha venido para perder las almas de los hombres, sino para salvarlas.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They went to another village.
As they went on the way, a certain man said to him,

block.text: Luego se fueron a otra aldea.
Mientras iban de camino, un hombre le dijo a Jesús:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I want to follow you wherever you go, Lord.”

block.text: Señor, deseo seguirte a dondequiera que vayas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Jesús le contestó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The foxes have holes, and the birds of the sky have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head.”

block.text: Las zorras tienen cuevas y las aves tienen nidos; pero el Hijo del hombre no tiene donde recostar la cabeza.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to another,

block.text: Jesús le dijo a otro:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Follow me!”

block.text: Sígueme.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said,

block.text: Pero él respondió:

block.characterId: disciple who wanted to bury his father

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: disciple who wanted to bury his father
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, allow me first to go and bury my father.”

block.text: Señor, déjame ir primero a enterrar a mi padre.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus said to him,

block.text: Jesús le contestó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Leave the dead to bury their own dead, but you go and announce the Kingdom of God.”

block.text: Deja que los muertos entierren a sus muertos; tú ve y anuncia el reino de Dios.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Another also said,

block.text: Otro le dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I want to follow you, Lord, but first allow me to say good-bye to those who are at my house.”

block.text: Señor, quiero seguirte, pero primero déjame ir a despedirme de los de mi casa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus said to him,

block.text: Jesús le contestó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “No one, having put his hand to the plow, and looking back, is fit for the Kingdom of God.”

block.text: El que pone la mano en el arado y sigue mirando atrás, no sirve para el reino de Dios.

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 10
Now after these things, the Lord appointed seventy-two others, and said:

block.text: Después de esto, el Señor escogió también a otros setenta y dos, y les dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am sending you out two by two into every city and place where I am about to go.”

block.text: <<Los envio de dos en dos delante de mi a toda ciudad y lugar adonde yo ire muy pronto>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he said to them,

block.text: Les dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The harvest is indeed plentiful, but the laborers are few. Pray therefore to the Lord of the harvest, that he may send out laborers into his harvest.

block.text: <<Ciertamente la cosecha es mucha, pero los trabajadores son pocos. Por eso, pidan ustedes al Dueño de la cosecha que mande trabajadores a recogerla.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Go your ways. Behold, I send you out as lambs among wolves.

block.text: Vayan ustedes; miren que los envío como corderos en medio de lobos.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Carry no purse, nor wallet, nor sandals. Greet no one on the way.

block.text: No lleven dinero ni provisiones ni sandalias; y no se detengan a saludar a nadie en el camino.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Into whatever house you enter, first say, ‘Peace be to this house.’

block.text: Cuando entren en una casa, saluden primero, diciendo: <Paz a esta casa.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: If a son of peace is there, your peace will rest on him; but if not, it will return to you.

block.text: Y si allí hay gente de paz, su deseo de paz se cumplirá; pero si no, ustedes nada perderán.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Remain in that same house, eating and drinking the things they give, for the laborer is worthy of his wages. Don't go from house to house.

block.text: Quédense en la misma casa, y coman y beban de lo que ellos tengan, pues el trabajador tiene derecho a su paga. No anden de casa en casa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Into whatever city you enter, and they receive you, eat the things that are set before you.

block.text: Al llegar a un pueblo donde los reciban, coman lo que les sirvan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Heal the sick who are therein, and tell them, ‘The Kingdom of God has come near to you.’

block.text: Sanen a los enfermos que haya allí, y díganles: <El reino de Dios ya está cerca de ustedes.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But into whatever city you enter, and they don't receive you, go out into its streets and say,

block.text: Pero si llegan a un pueblo y no los reciben, salgan a las calles diciendo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘Even the dust from your city that clings to us, we wipe off against you. Nevertheless know this, that the Kingdom of God has come near to you.’

block.text: <¡Hasta el polvo de su pueblo, que se ha pegado a nuestros pies, lo sacudimos como protesta contra ustedes! Pero sepan esto, que el reino de Dios ya está cerca de ustedes.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you, it will be more tolerable in that day for Sodom than for that city.”

block.text: Les digo que en aquel día el castigo para ese pueblo será peor que para la gente de Sodoma.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon which were done in you, they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.

block.text: <<¡Ay de ti, Corazín! ¡Ay de ti, Betsaida! Porque si en Tiro y Sidón se hubieran hecho los milagros que se han hecho entre ustedes, ya hace tiempo que se habrían vuelto a Dios, cubiertos de ropas ásperas y sentados en ceniza.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon in the judgment than for you.

block.text: Pero en el día del juicio el castigo para ustedes será peor que para la gente de Tiro y Sidón.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You, Capernaum, who are exalted to heaven, will be brought down to Hades.

block.text: Y tú, Cafarnaúm, ¿crees que serás levantado hasta el cielo? ¡Bajarás hasta lo más hondo del abismo!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever listens to you listens to me, and whoever rejects you rejects me. Whoever rejects me rejects him who sent me.”

block.text: <<El que los escucha a ustedes, me escucha a mí; y el que los rechaza a ustedes, me rechaza a mí; y el que me rechaza a mí, rechaza al que me envió.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The seventy returned with joy, saying,

block.text: Los setenta y dos regresaron muy contentos, diciendo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, even the demons are subject to us in your name!”

block.text: ¡Señor, hasta los demonios nos obedecen en tu nombre!

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Jesús les dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I saw Satan having fallen like lightning from heaven.

block.text: Sí, pues yo vi que Satanás caía del cielo como un rayo.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, I give you authority to tread on serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy. Nothing will in any way hurt you.

block.text: Yo les he dado poder a ustedes para caminar sobre serpientes y alacranes, y para vencer toda la fuerza del enemigo, sin sufrir ningún daño.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nevertheless, don't rejoice in this, that the spirits are subject to you, but rejoice that your names are written in heaven.”

block.text: Pero no se alegren de que los espíritus los obedezcan, sino de que sus nombres ya están escritos en el cielo.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In that same hour Jesus rejoiced in the Holy Spirit, and said,

block.text: En aquel momento, Jesús, lleno de alegría por el Espíritu Santo, dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I thank you, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you have hidden these things from the wise and understanding, and revealed them to little children. Yes, Father, for so it was well-pleasing in your sight.”

block.text: <<Te alabo, Padre, Señor del cielo y de la tierra, porque has mostrado a los sencillos las cosas que escondiste de los sabios y entendidos. Sí, Padre, porque así lo has querido.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “All things have been delivered to me by my Father. No one knows who the Son is, except the Father, and who the Father is, except the Son, and he to whomever the Son desires to reveal him.”

block.text: <<Mi Padre me ha entregado todas las cosas. Nadie sabe quién es el Hijo, sino el Padre; y nadie sabe quién es el Padre, sino el Hijo y aquellos a quienes el Hijo quiera darlo a conocer.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Turning to the disciples, he said privately,

block.text: Volviéndose a los discípulos, les dijo a ellos solos:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Blessed are the eyes which see the things that you see,

block.text: <<Dichosos quienes vean lo que ustedes están viendo;

ReferenceBlocks.text: for I tell you that many prophets and kings desired to see the things which you see, and didn't see them, and to hear the things which you hear, and didn't hear them.”

block.text: porque les digo que muchos profetas y reyes quisieron ver esto que ustedes ven, y no lo vieron; quisieron oir esto que ustedes oyen, y no lo oyeron.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, a certain lawyer stood up and tested him, saying,

block.text: Un maestro de la ley fue a hablar con Jesús, y para ponerlo a prueba le preguntó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?”

block.text: Maestro, ¿qué debo hacer para alcanzar la vida eterna?

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Jesús le contestó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What is written in the law? How do you read it?”

block.text: ¿Qué está escrito en la ley? ¿Qué es lo que lees?

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered,

block.text: El maestro de la ley contestó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your strength, and with all your mind; and your neighbor as yourself.”

block.text: <Ama al Señor tu Dios con todo tu corazón, con toda tu alma, con todas tus fuerzas y con toda tu mente>; y <ama a tu prójimo como a ti mismo.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Jesús le dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You have answered correctly. Do this, and you will live.”

block.text: Has contestado bien. Si haces eso, tendrás la vida.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he, desiring to justify himself, asked Jesus,

block.text: Pero el maestro de la ley, queriendo justificar su pregunta, dijo a Jesús:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who is my neighbor?”

block.text: ¿Y quién es mi prójimo?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered,

block.text: Jesús entonces le contestó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A certain man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and he fell among robbers, who both stripped him and beat him, and departed, leaving him half dead.

block.text: Un hombre iba por el camino de Jerusalén a Jericó, y unos bandidos lo asaltaron y le quitaron hasta la ropa; lo golpearon y se fueron, dejándolo medio muerto.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By chance a certain priest was going down that way. When he saw him, he passed by on the other side.

block.text: Por casualidad, un sacerdote pasaba por el mismo camino; pero al verlo, dio un rodeo y siguió adelante.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the same way a Levite also, when he came to the place, and saw him, passed by on the other side.

block.text: También un levita llegó a aquel lugar, y cuando lo vio, dio un rodeo y siguió adelante.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But a certain Samaritan, as he traveled, came where he was. When he saw him, he was moved with compassion.

block.text: Pero un hombre de Samaria que viajaba por el mismo camino, al verlo, sintió compasión.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came to him and bound up his wounds, pouring on oil and wine. He set him on his own animal, brought him to an inn, and took care of him.

block.text: Se acercó a él, le curó las heridas con aceite y vino, y le puso vendas. Luego lo subió en su propia cabalgadura, lo llevó a un alojamiento y lo cuidó.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On the next day, when he departed, he took out two denarii, and gave them to the host, and said to him, ‘Take care of him. Whatever you spend beyond that, I will repay you when I return.’”

block.text: Al día siguiente, el samaritano sacó el equivalente al salario de dos días, se lo dio al dueño del alojamiento y le dijo: <Cuide a este hombre, y si gasta usted algo más, yo se lo pagaré cuando vuelva.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Jesus asked him:

block.text: Jesus le pregunto:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Now which of these three do you think seemed to be a neighbor to him who fell among the robbers?”

block.text: <<Pues bien, ¿cuál de esos tres te parece que se hizo prójimo del hombre asaltado por los bandidos?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: El maestro de la ley contestó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He who showed mercy on him.”

block.text: El que tuvo compasión de él.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Jesus said to him,

block.text: Jesús le dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go and do likewise.”

block.text: Pues ve y haz tú lo mismo.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened as they went on their way, he entered into a certain village, and a certain woman named Martha received him into her house.

block.text: Jesús siguió su camino y llegó a una aldea, donde una mujer llamada Marta lo hospedó.

ReferenceBlocks.text: She had a sister called Mary, who also sat at Jesus’ feet, and heard his word.

block.text: Marta tenía una hermana llamada María, la cual se sentó a los pies de Jesús para escuchar lo que él decía.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Martha was distracted with much serving, and she came up to him, and said,

block.text: Pero Marta, que estaba atareada con sus muchos quehaceres, se acercó a Jesús y le dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, don't you care that my sister left me to serve alone? Ask her therefore to help me.”

block.text: Señor, ¿no te preocupa nada que mi hermana me deje sola con todo el trabajo? Dile que me ayude.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered her,

block.text: Pero Jesús le contestó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Martha, Martha, you are anxious and troubled about many things,
but one thing is needed. Mary has chosen the good part, which will not be taken away from her.”

block.text: Marta, Marta, estás preocupada y te inquietas por demasiadas cosas,
pero solo una cosa es necesaria. María ha escogido la mejor parte, y nadie se la va a quitar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 11
It happened, that when he finished praying in a certain place, one of his disciples said to him,

block.text: Una vez, Jesús estaba orando en un lugar; cuando terminó, uno de sus discípulos le dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, teach us to pray, just as John also taught his disciples.”

block.text: Señor, enséñanos a orar, lo mismo que Juan enseñó a sus discípulos.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Jesús les dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When you pray, say, ‘Our Father in heaven, may your name be kept holy. May your Kingdom come. May your will be done on earth, as it is in heaven.

block.text: Cuando oren, digan: <Padre, santificado sea tu nombre. Venga tu reino.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Give us day by day our daily bread.

block.text: Danos cada día el pan que necesitamos.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Forgive us our sins, for we ourselves also forgive everyone who is indebted to us. Bring us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil.’”

block.text: Perdónanos nuestros pecados, porque también nosotros perdonamos a todos los que nos han hecho mal. No nos expongas a la tentación.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: También les dijo Jesús:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Which of you, if you go to a friend at midnight, and tell him, ‘Friend, lend me three loaves of bread.

block.text: Supongamos que uno de ustedes tiene un amigo, y que a medianoche va a su casa y le dice: <Amigo, préstame tres panes,

ReferenceBlocks.text: A friend of mine has come to me from a journey, and I have nothing to set before him.’

block.text: porque un amigo mío acaba de llegar de viaje a mi casa, y no tengo nada que darle.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He from within will answer and say, ‘Don't bother me. The door is now shut, and my children are with me in bed. I can't get up and give it to you?’

block.text: Sin duda el otro no le contestará desde adentro: <No me molestes; la puerta está cerrada, y mis hijos y yo ya estamos acostados; no puedo levantarme a darte nada.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you, although he will not rise and give it to him because he is his friend, yet because of his persistence, he will get up and give him as many as he needs.”

block.text: Les digo que, aunque no se levante a darle algo por ser su amigo, lo hará por su impertinencia, y le dará todo lo que necesita.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I tell you, keep asking, and it will be given you. Keep seeking, and you will find. Keep knocking, and it will be opened to you.

block.text: Así que yo les digo: Pidan, y Dios les dará; busquen, y encontrarán; llamen a la puerta, y se les abrirá.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For everyone who asks receives. He who seeks finds. To him who knocks it will be opened.”

block.text: Porque el que pide, recibe; y el que busca, encuentra; y al que llama a la puerta, se le abre.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Which of you fathers, if your son asks for bread, will give him a stone? Or if he asks for a fish, he won't give him a snake instead of a fish, will he?

block.text: <<¿Acaso alguno de ustedes, que sea padre, sería capaz de darle a su hijo una culebra cuando le pide pescado,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or if he asks for an egg, he won't give him a scorpion, will he?

block.text: o de darle un alacrán cuando le pide un huevo?

ReferenceBlocks.text: If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him?”

block.text: Pues si ustedes, que son malos, saben dar cosas buenas a sus hijos, ¡cuánto más el Padre celestial dará el Espíritu Santo a quienes se lo pidan!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was casting out a demon, and it was mute. It happened, when the demon had gone out, the mute man spoke; and the multitudes marveled.

block.text: Jesús estaba expulsando un demonio que había dejado mudo a un hombre; y cuando el demonio salió, el mudo comenzó a hablar. La gente se admiró de esto,

ReferenceBlocks.text: But some of them said,

block.text: pero algunos dijeron:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He casts out demons by Beelzebul, the prince of the demons.”

block.text: <<Beelzebú, el jefe de los demonios, es quien ha dado a este hombre el poder de expulsarlos.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others, trying to trap him said:

block.text: Otros, para tenderle una trampa, le dijeron:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Show us a sign from Heaven!”

block.text: <<Muestranos una senal del cielo>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he, knowing their thoughts, said to them,

block.text: Pero él, que sabía lo que estaban pensando, les dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation. A house divided against itself falls.

block.text: <<Todo país dividido en bandos enemigos, se destruye a sí mismo y todas sus casas se derrumban una sobre otra.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If Satan also is divided against himself, how will his kingdom stand? For you say that I cast out demons by Beelzebul.

block.text: Así también, si Satanás se divide contra sí mismo, ¿cómo mantendrá su poder? Esto lo digo porque ustedes afirman que yo expulso los demonios por el poder de Beelzebú;

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if I cast out demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your children cast them out? Therefore will they be your judges.

block.text: pero si es así, ¿quién da a los seguidores de ustedes el poder para expulsarlos? Por eso, ellos mismos los condenarán a ustedes.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if I by the finger of God cast out demons, then the Kingdom of God has come to you.”

block.text: Porque si yo expulso los demonios por la mano de Dios, eso significa que el reino de Dios ya ha llegado a ustedes.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When the strong man, fully armed, guards his own dwelling, his goods are safe.

block.text: <<Cuando un hombre fuerte está bien armado y cuida su casa, lo que en ella guarda está seguro.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when someone stronger attacks him and overcomes him, he takes from him his whole armor in which he trusted, and divides his spoils.”

block.text: Pero si otro más fuerte que él viene y lo vence, le quita las armas en que confía, y sus pertenencias, y dispone de ellas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He that is not with me is against me. He who doesn't gather with me scatters.

block.text: <<El que no está a mi favor, está en contra mía, y el que conmigo no recoge, desparrama.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The unclean spirit, when he has gone out of the man, passes through dry places, seeking rest, and finding none, he says, ‘I will turn back to my house from which I came out.’

block.text: <<Cuando un espíritu impuro sale de un hombre, anda por lugares secos buscando descanso; pero, al no encontrarlo, piensa: <Volveré a mi casa, de donde salí.>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he returns, he finds it swept and put in order.

block.text: Cuando regresa, encuentra a ese hombre como una casa barrida y arreglada.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he goes, and takes seven other spirits more evil than himself, and they enter in and dwell there. The last state of that man becomes worse than the first.”

block.text: Entonces va y reúne otros siete espíritus peores que él, y todos juntos se meten a vivir en aquel hombre, que al final queda peor que al principio.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: It came to pass, as he said these things, a certain woman out of the multitude lifted up her voice, and said to him,

block.text: Mientras Jesús decía estas cosas, una mujer entre la gente gritó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Blessed is the womb that bore you, and the breasts which nursed you!”

block.text: ¡Dichosa la mujer que te dio a luz y te crió!

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said,

block.text: él contestó:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “On the contrary, blessed are those who hear the word of God, and keep it.”

block.text: ¡Dichosos más bien quienes escuchan lo que Dios dice, y lo obedecen!

ReferenceBlocks.text: As the multitudes continued to increase, he began to say,

block.text: La multitud seguía juntándose alrededor de Jesús, y él comenzó a decirles:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is an evil generation. It seeks after a sign. No sign will be given to it but the sign of Jonah, the prophet.

block.text: <<La gente de este tiempo es malvada; pide una señal milagrosa, pero no va a dársele más señal que la de Jonás.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For even as Jonah became a sign to the Ninevites, so will also the Son of Man be to this generation.

block.text: Pues así como Jonás fue una señal para la gente de Nínive, también el Hijo del hombre será una señal para la gente de este tiempo.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Queen of the South will rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation, and will condemn them: for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and behold, one greater than Solomon is here.

block.text: En el día del juicio, cuando se juzgue a la gente de este tiempo, la reina del Sur se levantará y la condenará; porque ella vino de lo más lejano de la tierra para escuchar la sabiduría de Salomón, y lo que hay aquí es mayor que Salomón.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The men of Nineveh will stand up in the judgment with this generation, and will condemn it: for they repented at the preaching of Jonah, and behold, one greater than Jonah is here.”

block.text: También los de Nínive se levantarán en el día del juicio, cuando se juzgue a la gente de este tiempo, y la condenarán; porque los de Nínive se volvieron a Dios cuando oyeron el mensaje de Jonás, y lo que hay aquí es mayor que Jonás.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “No one, when he has lit a lamp, puts it in a cellar or under a basket, but on a stand, that those who come in may see the light.

block.text: <<Nadie enciende una lámpara y la pone en un lugar escondido, ni bajo un cajón, sino en alto, para que los que entran tengan luz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The lamp of the body is the eye. Therefore when your eye is good, your whole body is also full of light; but when it is evil, your body also is full of darkness.

block.text: Tus ojos son la lámpara del cuerpo; si tus ojos son buenos, todo tu cuerpo tendrá luz; pero si son malos, tu cuerpo estará en la oscuridad.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore see whether the light that is in you isn't darkness.

block.text: Ten cuidado de que la luz que hay en ti no resulte oscuridad.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If therefore your whole body is full of light, having no part dark, it will be wholly full of light, as when the lamp with its bright shining gives you light.”

block.text: Pues si todo tu cuerpo tiene luz y no hay en él ninguna oscuridad, lo verás todo claramente, como cuando una lámpara te alumbra con su luz.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus finished speaking, a Pharisee invited him to dinner at his house, saying:

block.text: Cuando Jesús dejó de hablar, un fariseo lo invitó a comer en su casa, diciendo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come dine with me.”

block.text: <<Come conmigo>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went in, and sat at the table.

block.text: Jesús entró y se sentó a la mesa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the Pharisee saw it, he marveled that he had not first washed himself before dinner.

block.text: El fariseo se extrañó al ver que no había cumplido con la ceremonia de lavarse antes de comer.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Lord said to him,

block.text: Pero el Señor le dijo:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Now you Pharisees cleanse the outside of the cup and of the platter, but your inward part is full of extortion and wickedness.

block.text: Ustedes los fariseos limpian por fuera el vaso y el plato, pero por dentro ustedes están llenos de lo que han conseguido por medio del robo y la maldad.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You foolish ones, didn't he who made the outside make the inside also?

block.text: ¡Necios! ¿No saben que el que hizo lo de fuera, hizo también lo de dentro?

ReferenceBlocks.text: But give for gifts to the needy those things which are within, and behold, all things will be clean to you.

block.text: Den ustedes sus limosnas de lo que está dentro, y así todo quedará limpio.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But woe to you Pharisees! For you tithe mint and rue and every herb, but you bypass justice and the love of God. You ought to have done these, and not to have left the other undone.

block.text: <<¡Ay de ustedes, fariseos!, que separan para Dios la décima parte de la menta, de la ruda y de toda clase de legumbres, pero no hacen caso de la justicia y el amor a Dios. Esto es lo que deben hacer, sin dejar de hacer lo otro.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Woe to you Pharisees! For you love the best seats in the synagogues, and the greetings in the marketplaces.

block.text: <<¡Ay de ustedes, fariseos!, que quieren tener los asientos de honor en las sinagogas, y que desean que la gente los salude con todo respeto en las calles.
